title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: October 13
body:
Hi all,

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped.
If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Health Bar Improvements**

We've got some health bar improvements coming to the PBE in the next week or two. Some of the changes will be more subtle stuff like making it a bit easier to tell how much damage you just took/dealt based off how the bar updates. Other changes will be more explicit like adding a clearer visualization for champs with resurrection effects available (Zac, Anivia, GA etc) so that figuring out whether someone will respawn or not doesn't have to involve digging through a bunch of icons on the buffbar. 

A lot more details about those changes to come from the team working on them once they're on PBE. We'll be continuing to work on them while they're on PBE, so feedback once they're there would be highly appreciated.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Item Tweaking in Pre-Season**

In addition to base stat and ability adjustments we're trying out some item changes to also adjust for the impact of runes. We're buffing a range of items, primarily those that offer magic pen or lethality, to compensate for damage their users have otherwise lost. The particular items in question were chosen because they both generally offer anti champion power (what was lost, and we don't want to increase waveclear unnecessarily) and because they're pretty closely tied to champs who need a bit more help in the new runes world. We're still planning to look at AP items as well sometime early next year, it's likely a change or two we'd originally been considering for that package of work gets pulled forwards and done here though. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**7.21 will be a really light patch**

Just a quick reminder that there won't be much in 7.21 given there's so much coming in 7.22. A few small balance adjustments, but nothing too major. Most of it's on the PBE already, possible we get one or two more things depending on what time permits though (chance of Udyr buffs, Locket adjustments). 




http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.24.1/img/champion/Ziggs.png

I can think of an answer: Hi!

Hey since you are talking about improving health bars. Have you guys at Riot considered **adding a counter on the health bars for stacking champions** like Nasus, Sion, Kindred, Veigar, Bard, Rengar, Cho Gath and Thresh. 

----------------------------------------------

I think adding a counter to this champions would help a lot with clarity, since their power is related specifically to how many stacks they have (especially champions like Kindred and Bard who don't scale linearly). This would also help inexperienced players who could approach a character like Nasus and Veigar and not understand how they got one shotted.

I agree that we should better communicate scaling power for stacking champs, both before and after you've been one-shotted, but we are not planning to add this kind of info to the health bar above a champ's head.

The main reason is uptime. A number like that would be  floating up there the entire game whether it was relevant or not. Other than basic resources like health and mana, we feel the healthbar space should be reserved for much more timely info or else you end up with a cluttered game-space pretty quickly.

Totally different scenario would be if those champs gained that enormous offensive power off a button press in-the-moment.

why not display "milestones" graphically then? Like for veigar/nasus for ever 50 stacks you could put a small little graphic like a star or a notch or something to indicate the milestone has been reached, and improve or add more as more milestones are achieved. that way you can tell at a glance roughly how strong the champ is without it completely cluttering the HUD
For sure if we did something in game space we would need to use milestones rather than an exact number.

While I understand your point, I still feel a counter or some other way of communicating what the power level of some champs like Nasus and Veigar -- which is directly tied to how many stacks they have -- is necessary to improve clarity in the game for inexperienced players.

Since the health bar is already used to communicate "the bounty target" in Garen's and Kindred's bounty system, I was under the impression that you were open to adding more communication tools to the health bar in the future. The next best solution I think would be to add in-game cues to the characters that scale with stacks, similar to how Cho Gath scales in size and Bard has more meeps

----------------------------

* **Rengar:** Global Quote/Rawr to enemy champions whenever he gets a bounty stack

* **Kindred:** Global Quote/Sound each time they achieve the next power level

* **Nasus and Veigar:** Glowing particles on their model that gets more pronounced every 50 stacks or particles/effects that "scale" in another way

* ** Veigar 2:** His voice could be modified so that the more stacks he gets, the more "evil" he sounds (teaches inexperienced players they are getting more powerful) 

* **Thresh:** Lanterns gets brighter by X number of stacks

* **Bard:** Global sound by X number of chimes collected

* ** Sion** you can look at his health bar already I guess, but his belly could glow briefly and make a sound by X number of stacks so inexperienced players know they are doing a good job

We haven't explored a solution, but I could see the scoreboard (TAB screen) being a really good fit for this kind of info. You're already tracking overall power of a champ through CS, KDA, items, etc. Veigar or Nasus stacks exists in the same kind of evaluation IMO. What do you think?

EDIT: In addition to an in-game, on-model effect. Show that power curve.
Kindred would be unfitting since she gets stacks from counterjungling and everyone already sees the marks. So everyone would know where she is once she gets a jungle stack
Could treat her stacks like items and jg cs and not show unless you have vision of her.

We'll be patching regardless to put out bug fixes and, I'd imagine, a few skins if nothing else. If there's something we're confident is a good change that will still be applicable after pre-season hits (e.g. Sejuani being a bit strong, therefore getting nerfed) makes sense we feel to make that change quicker and get the benefit of it rather than waiting.

Yay, my favorite subject - magic pen!

Look, I'm not going to complain about having more mpen, but these changes are not tailored to address the problems with mages who stack flat pen or rely on piercing thoughts + DFT, but it's such a broad buff that low pen mages are coming out ahead.

We need changes that will address the issue of power curve and scaling for the first group without giving too much free pen to mages who are less dependent on pen for their scaling.

* Revert changes to Sorcs and Void
* Lower Guise pen to 10 (unique passive, not Eyes of Pain) and reduce cost
* Liandry's keeps Guise's 10 flat pen (not Eyes of Pain) and gains 2% pen (or bonus MR pen?) per tick, doubled to 4% against movement impaired units (unique passive)
* New item: Lost Chapter + Guise + Amp Tome (or Guise + Amp Tome + Catalyst) with Eyes of Pain (20 mpen)
* Protobelt: Guise + Hextech Revolver with Eyes of Pain (20 mpen)

The idea is to smooth out power spikes by making pen components more accessible instead of just making pen spikes bigger. The Guise + Chapter (or Cata) item would be a great rush item; fill a distinct niche between Morello, ROA, and Archangel; and maintain the power curve for mages who need some early pen + Precision but don't necessarily stack pen. And it's usable by champs with no feet.

The point of the Liandry's change is to give pen-stacking and dot mages a flat pen component early that builds into % shred item to maintain scaling in late game. The % pen is mostly just replacing Piercing Thoughts and stacks over 3 seconds, making it unappealing to burst mages.

I'll spare you the math, but the True Damage threshold with this itemization is 1 MR away from live, and the power curve is more fair to mages and enemies alike. Don't believe me? Assuming max pen, here are the intervals:

Live: 22 at spawn > 37 at boots > 52 at 1 component > 52+35% at 2 items > 56 + 35% at lvl 18

Reforged: 0 at spawn > 15 at boots > 25 at first component > 35 at full item > 45 at item + component > 45 + 6-12% at two items > 45 + 51-57% at three items

Balance achieved.

**TL;DR: This idea works, is more fair, and is more sustainable. Free pen on Sorcs and Void are not the right changes. These buffs are disproportionately strong in some fights (eg Syndra/Veigar vs. any squishy) and disproportionately weak in other fights (eg Cassio/Zyra vs. Galio, Vlad, etc).**

 I mean buffs that try to put stuff like {{champion:72}} {{champion:203}}   back into the meta?

How's {{champion:28}} looking so far on live even with the current runes and masteries?

Runes update will be a bit of a balance reset overall, so we'll be looking at the roster as a whole with fresh eyes.

Eve's performing fairly well in jungle for a champ with some learning curve, definitely doesn't seem out of line though. At one point in testing we saw her laning be really dominant via some really low counterplay stuff and we built a number of restrictions into her kit to avoid that being a problem. Looks like we did more than was necessary there though, so at the least we'll likely ease off on some stuff that'll help laning Eve out a bit/might buff jungle Eve slightly (e.g. Q having a lower CD, and lower refund on monsters, E rank 1 damage higher).

On the topic of Evelynn, I recall hearing that you'd test 'Minion damage does not reset Demon Shade's cooldown' for Evelynn. Have you decided whether this would be an appropriate change for Evelynn, or are you worried it would overbuff Lane Eve (I admit, her passive seems like it'd be a pretty good way to say in lane if your opponent doesn't have the tools to burst you down quickly)?
Oh, yeah, we'll be trying that too, though I don't know how confident to be it'll ship or not yet though.

I'm going to repost this since it's a good question:

"I have a genuine question that no rioter has seem to be able to answer yet.
Why do assassins have larger windows of burst when mages and adc's don't? Why delay some champions but then leave others to delete people in .000001 seconds? Why is it only bad when certain assassins do it?
Notice that assassin kayn has no delayed burst too.

I truly do think you guys should get rid of the delayed burst thing. It creates too large of a window for adc's to melt the class that's supposed to counter them."

The vast majority of assassins are hyper-mobile â€” they can get in and kill you, then almost immediately get out. Before their damage output had a more significant time delay added to it, they were excruciatingly frustrating to play against, especially if you couldn't match their mobility, or didn't rush a high-price, low-combat-efficiency defensive item; there would be significant chunks of time in a match where you had basically zero counterplay against instantly being killed as certain roles.

Conversely, most burst mages are immobile, slow, and have higher starting cooldowns that can be punished. Barring one or two (coughcoughSyndra), they also tend to be highly reliant on skillshots for bursting people instantly, meaning their damage can be dodged. Very few mages can exert strong roaming pressure like assassins can, as well.

ADCs, though, have been problematic for a while â€” not necessarily in terms of their general killing potential, but in how quickly they can *achieve* that killing potential, how that killing potential applies to not only champions but also turrets and Drake/Baron, and the added protection that they get because of their universal threat.

The strength and sheer variety in their item choices coupled with a "protect the ADC" meta have let even "scaling" builds powerspike really early. Someone standing there right-clicking you is going to kill you in about the same timeframe as an assassin given equal tools, which would be fine, but now top and jungle are usually expected to play secondary support to the ADC, and the primary support is forced into rushing their strongest ADC-enabling item because their other choices are terrible. ADCs will have an entire team backing them up, even more than they used to.

Yes, ADC is overpowered, but that doesn't mean assassins need buffs. People have been complaining about powercreep for years; we don't need to remove an important balancing factor to one role so that it can become broken, just to compete with another role that's already broken and needs nerfs.
